responses.content: Meta AI is scaling toward one billion people, with a focus on highly personalized experiences and multimodal agents, while Llama 4 prepares to deliver agentic capabilities, omni-model reasoning, and the foundation for future AI engineering agents.

Ray-Ban Meta AI glasses validate the glasses form factor for AI, and we are investing billions in infrastructure—almost a gigawatt of capacity this year and multi-gigawatt campuses—to fund AI and core services while keeping product momentum across Family apps.

Family apps continue to grow (3.3B+ DAP) and we are experimenting with new feeds, Reels features, Threads growth, and creator tools, while making our social apps more culturally influential and preparing for a metaverse- and AI-infused future.

Total revenue was $48.4B (+21%), total expenses $25B (+5%) after favorable legal accrual adjustments, operating income $23.4B (48% margin), net income $20.8B, and free cash flow $13.2B. We returned capital with $1.3B in dividends and ended the year with $77.8B in cash and equivalents.

Family of Apps revenue grew 21% to $47.3B, with ads up 21% aided by higher video time and improved ad performance; advertising growth was strongest in Rest-of-World (+27%), Asia Pacific (+23%), and Europe (+22%), while ad impressions rose 6% and average price per ad +14%.

Reality Labs revenue was $1.1B (+1%) while expenses rose 6% to $6B, reflecting continued content, hardware, and infrastructure investments as we scale Quest and Horizon; RL operating loss remained near $5B.

CapEx was $14.8B; full-year 2025 guidance is $60-65B with the biggest growth in servers, followed by data centers and networking, supporting generative AI, core AI, and long-term infrastructure; we expect to keep using servers ~5.5 years to lower depreciation.

responses.topic: Meta AI adoption and monetization path
responses.content: Meta AI logged 700M MAUs, with WhatsApp leading usage for info, education, and emotional support; we are enhancing memory, personalization, and content recommendations while keeping monetization experiments focused on a great consumer experience and saving revenue ramps for once the product reaches massive scale.

Headcount grew 10% to ~74K, with nearly 90% of new hires in R&D and infrastructure; we expect additional technical hiring for infrastructure, monetization, Reality Labs, generative AI, and compliance while keeping business function hiring constrained, and we continue ramping AI coding assistants to boost engineer productivity.

questions: Mark, how are Meta AI interactions evolving and do they extend to commercial intent? Are you still partnering with external search providers instead of building in-house?
Susan, how should we think about headcount investments going into 2025 to support infrastructure and AI initiatives?
Mark, what are the biggest opportunity sets for applying AI across products and internal processes, and what learnings are emerging from the business planning cycle?
Mark, how do you expect Meta AI agentic capabilities to expand beyond longer queries?
Susan, is the $15B-17B Q4 CapEx run rate sustainable into 2025?
Mark, how is AI improving R&D productivity?
Susan, how flexible is headcount planning as you manage cost growth?
Susan, can you describe the health of the digital ad market and how you're balancing pricing versus impressions?
Mark, what’s the next wave of monetization for Reels and Threads beyond basic ad units?
How should we weigh Family of Apps revenue growth vs. cost growth going forward?
Can you explain the drivers behind elevated Q1 G&A, particularly legal expenses?
Mark, how do you leverage third-party Llama updates and open-source work to incubate ideas internally?
Susan, with Llama 3.1 training on 16K H100s and planning 600K, how are you structuring the CapEx roadmap for training vs. inference?
Do you plan to open Llama 3.1 to broader web developers, and could it link to commercial search?
Can you detail the opportunity to deepen the Ray-Ban Meta Glasses partnership?
Susan, how much revenue hinges on election/sports events and how do those impact comps?
How far is WhatsApp monetization from reaching its potential?
